is it possible to install ubuntu server along side ubuntu desktop + windows xp? as a dualboot
possible yes, but probably also pointless.  Just install the server applications on your desktop ubuntu
did you see what I said before about there not being much point in having both desktop and server?  Why *exactly* do you want both installed?
i want the desktop so i can still browse the web etc using gnome but i also want ubuntu server as a dual boot becoz having a server with ubuntu desktop uses to much ram

but what's the point of a server that's almost never on... If you actually want to do this, it is trivial: just put in the disk and install the server on a new partition.  But I don't see the point.  Just disable gdm by default and any other services that bother you on the desktop

fine, then just install it to a new partition
if you use the grub from the last install it should automatically detect the other ubuntu install.  If not, just look up grub chainloading
